results.title: Inside Newfoundland
results.creator_credit: Roger Morin, Sydney Newman and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Canada’s tenth province—its people, its resources, its way of life. The camera shows us St. John’s, the capital city; Cornerbrook, pulp and paper center; and Bell Island with its iron mine. The greatest wealth of Newfoundland is her people, and a visit with Fred Greeley, inshore fisherman and his family, introduces us to our fellow Canadians. Finally the importance of Newfoundland’s airports is stressed, and we visit Gander, where international air travellers come and go from the four corners of the globe.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Roger Morin, Sydney Newman and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Inside Magoo
results.creator_credit: John F. Becker, Stephen Bosustow, American Cancer Society and United Productions of America
results.brief_description: A highly entertaining and informative educational film combining both animation and live-action explaining the seven danger signals of cancer. Underlines the importance of regular medical check-ups to guard your health. Stresses the need for early diagnosis before cancer has spread throughout the body. Featuring Jim Backus in the role of Mr Magoo.

results.title: Inside Australia's Parliament House
results.creator_credit: Craig Chapman, Bill Bowtell and Entertainment Incorporated
results.brief_description: Ita Buttrose takes you behind the scenes into the private and public areas of the magnificent Parliament House. With the help of four Australian Prime Ministers and the building’s creator, Aldo Giurgola, you will be guided with an insight that’s entertaining, intimate and totally fascinating. You are shown the Prime Minister’s office and private courtyard; Cabinet rooms; Hi-tech banquet kitchens; Parliamentarians’ offices; Great Hall; Members’ Hall; Chambers of Senate and House of Representatives, plus the vast offering of paintings, ceramics, sculpture, mosaics, stained glass, tapestries, special gifts from many nations; and more. Narrated by George Negus.

results.title: Insects: how to recognise them
results.brief_description: Compares similarities and differences among insects in major groups. Differentiates between insects and other animals and shows the developmental stages through which insects pass from egg to adult. Shows parts of insects and briefly describes their functions. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.

results.title: Insects: a world of diversity (MAC)
results.brief_description: SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS: Apple Macintosh computer, 13 inch colour monitor (or larger), 4MB RAM, CD-ROM drive. Spectacular insect fauna comes to life in a unique exploration of biological diversity. This is a multimedia experience that will inform and inspire an exploration of the insect world. It has been designed to be of value to everybody interested in nature, from primary school age and up. Includes colour photographs of live insects, recordings of sound producing insects, digital video documentaries and information on identifying, catching and keeping insects.

results.title: Insects helpful to man
results.brief_description: Shows how humans benefit from the the activities of some insects. Includes a discussion of the benefits derived from bees, silkworms, maggots, dung beetles, lady bugs and ichneumon flies. Suitable for lower secondary level.
